snippet: The Assembly and Senate have agreed to extend the existing law, which had expired, until next Tuesday, but the chambers seem to be far apart on a long-term resolution.
abstract: New York State lawmakers have failed to come to agreement over law governing setting price of rents for over million apartments in New York City, leading to mounting frustration and uncertainty; existing law has been extended for short time to allow lawmakers to reach compromise, but Senate leadership has yet to respond to new proposal from Assembly.

byline.contributor: Susanne Craig and Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Assembly and Senate have agreed to extend the existing law, which had expired, until next Tuesday, but the chambers seem to be far apart on a long-term resolution.

headline.main: Uncertainty Mounting as Little Progress Is Seen in Albany on Rent Regulations
headline.print_headline: Uncertainty Mounting as Little Progress Is Seen in Albany on Rent Regulations
